meanings.definition: A military or political leader in Spanish-speaking countries.
meanings.sent1: The caudillo led his troops into battle with great courage.
meanings.sent2: The caudillo's speeches inspired loyalty and respect among his followers.
meanings.sent3: The caudillo tried to negotiate peace by offering olive branches instead of swords.
meanings.sent4: The caudillo's influence over the nation was as strong as a mighty oak tree.
meanings.sent5: The image of the caudillo in his uniform became a symbol of authority and power.

meanings.sent1: The caudillo ruled with an iron fist, suppressing any opposition.
meanings.sent2: The country lived in fear under the rule of the caudillo.
meanings.sent3: The caudillo's strict rules even applied to the color of socks people could wear.
meanings.sent4: The caudillo's grip on power was as tight as a vice.
meanings.sent5: The caudillo's portrait hung in every government office, a constant reminder of his authority.
